Reviews.Title: “Average for a 2 star-hotel”
Reviews.Author: vienna_myCapital
Reviews.Content: I want to stress it out: the Ercoli is an acceptable hotel considering it is a 2-star facility. However there is no way I will ever stay there again. What is good about Ercoli is mainly its location: it is quite central, near to a subway station and it is a convenient starting point for excursions into the city. For such a location, the night fee is also reasonable. Keep in mind though that this hotel does not have its own building. It is a small facility within a large historical building. A buiding that hosts another small hotel and a few private apartments, too. It is not something uncommon in Rome and some people might find it "exotic". I just did not like it. The new management had the hotel's interior renovated and the result is absolutely pleasant, but... you just should have seen my room! It was tiny small! Although equpped with a nice closet, a small safe and a small last-generation tv, it was a mouse trap! Even worse, the only window could not be open for some scaffolding was obstructing it and I spent 3 days in total darkness. Finally it was ice cold! No matter, how high I set the temperature of the heater, I only got cold air out of it. And there was no chance to get any help from the reception as from 7 pm (even earlier) to 8 am (when I was there) the only staff available was an old gentleman, uncapable of any assistance. Also, bear in mind that, as it is a small hotel, you can hear any single word spoken at the reception! But the really amusing part of the story still has to come: the bathroom. So incredibly tiny that they had to leave the clean towels on my bed; So incredibly tiny that there was no way to keep one's toiletries anywhere! The smell coming out from the shower was not particularly appealing either! I must say though that everything was clean and the room was provided with extra blankets and an extra pillow. Finally the breakfast was good. As I said, for a 2-star hotel you should not expect more that tee, coffee, cereals, yougurth, bread, croissants and some cheese. The fruit looked quite... gloomy but the rest was fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel E. Coli”
Reviews.Author: GreatScottTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was inexpensive. But you get what you pay for...and in cases like Hotel Ercoli, more than we bargained for. About the property: The entrance and stairway reeked of mold making it smelly and dirty. We saw feces on the toilet seat and dead insects in the room. Breakfast was disgusting and because one of our party got food poisioning from it during our stay, we nicknamed Hotel Ercoli... "Hotel E. Coli." About the area: a store was broken into during our stay right near our hotel. Nothing was open late in our area, and we found the streets a dimly lit around the hotel. The elevator is old and rickety and the stairs are uneven and treacherous. Tomas (who also lives at the hotel in addition to working there) doesn't speak English and will belittle you if you don't speak Italian well. (I have two years of college level Italian, and he berated me constantly for not speaking it better as well as the rest of our group.) This is the worst experience I've ever had at a hotel, and I have traveled all over North America, Europe, and Asia. I try to be patient with hotel staff and understanding because I know they have a difficult job and you can't please everybody. At first, we tried to have a sense of humor about the staff's aggressive attitude and the dirtiness, and the air conditioning that they refused to turn on. Our patience and good humor was quickly worn thin. I only booked this hotel because of the glowing reviews here on TripAdvisor and the price, and was sorely mislead for the first time. However, this was not our first visit to Rome. We love this city so much, and though we tried desperately not to let it, the horrible experience of this hotel poisoned our trip. Spend a little more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Leonor A
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my trip to Rome and i've to say that it was wonderful. The hotel is very decent and clean with a great staff. I have to thanks to Tommaso, he was incredible. Very friendly, nice and thoughful. The breakfast was very tasty. If you're looking for a nice place with a nice price, Hotel Ercoli is that place.

Reviews.Title: “Warm staff, felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Talilit
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ercoli hotel. We thought it was more of a 3 stars hotel. The room was very clean, the breakfast was very rich and satisfying, and the staff was very friendly. The hotel is situated in a nice neighborhood but is a bit far from the center. There are bus lines arriving close to the hotel, we walked a few times but it can be exhausting. There are nice restaurants in the area. It is a Great value for the money. Flavio helped us a lot with directions, recommendations and everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: PhillyPhoodLover
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Ercoli was very nice and with one exception, they all spoke English very well. The breakfast served complimentary was delicious and very similar to the one in the hotel in Venice that we paid almost twice as much for. It had flaky croissant, strong Italian coffee, cured meats, cheeses, the freshest fruit I'd ever had, tomatoes, olive oil, vinegar, rolls, boiled eggs .... The rooms were clean, nice but small, however most European hotel rooms are smaller than the American version. Our street-side room was a bit noisy, but there was construction on the building across the street. We walked to Termini in a few minutes or took cabs. Cab rides were quite affordable because the hotel is nearby most attractions. It only cost 11 Euro to get to the Vatican and 6 Euro to get to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget option”
Reviews.Author: YourFriendInItaly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels, family owned B&Bs & other types of accommodation in Italy, etc. Hotel Ercoli can be loosely classified as a "hotel". As you walk into the main building, each floor consists of either a small 2 star hotel, pensione and residential apartments. To make your way to Ercoli, you go up the small old fashioned elevator to the floor where it's located. When I entered the small reception area, I was welcomed by a friendly older man that didnt speak much English. Luckily my Italian gone me by. As soon as he showed me to my room, it was clear that the AC (which is advertised on their website) was not on. So, I kindly asked him to turn it on but he said they dont turn it on for another 1-2 hours (meanwhile, it was already close to 7PM and one of the hottest days this Sept). Later, I asked again to turn the AC on because the room didnt cool down after opening the window. The man turned it on but it was only blowing hot air. A few hours later, I advised him it still wasnt working so he flipped another switch but that didnt help either. Needless to say I didnt sleep that night! The next morning I asked the girl working the front desk if they can fix the AC or change my room. She said there was nothing they could do about the AC and they were fully booked. So, luckily, I find another hotel down the road at almost the same rate and checked out of Ercoli. It is interesting to see that many guests that have reviewed this hotel have had the same issue about the AC. So, if this is a consistent problem, then dont advertise the hotel has AC. Overall, the "hotel" might be an average budget option depending on if you are are ok with fairly dark and modern rooms that lack character. This is a very basic hotel and the pics on the website make it look nicer and as if it's a hotel that is bigger than it really is. that being said, the rooms were clean and a decent size; just dont expect any frills...and possbily no AC.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option, 15 min walk from Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: kobdik
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night only. Flew in to Rome relatively late traveling to Amalfi Coast first thing in the morning, hence wanted to look for accommodation close to Termini. This hotel is perfect if you have similar plans. Rooms clean and comfy, bathroom spotless too. Breakfast was surprisingly good after all I read about Italian preferences for the 'colazione', I mean it was the typical European what-you'd-expect but served by nice and polite staff. Wide selection of teas as well, so I'm told ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good breakfast, beware of payment options, ask for A/C.”
Reviews.Author: tumido
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice. It is located on the third floor in a building with two or three other hotels. Because of this you are given a key for the door to the building, a key to the door of the hotel and a key for your room. The hotel itself is really clean and looks very modern. Maps of Roma are provided at the reception. There's even a Spark Notes of Roma there if you need it. The rooms are also clean and modern. There are a few hundred channels on the TV, so it's impossible not to find one in your language. There's a safe. The bathroom has a big shower and comes with soap, shower cap, shampoo and skin lotion. The only problem with the room was that the A/C didn't work the first two nights. And it wasn't because it was broken, but as we realized the third night, because they had stopped the central A/C unit from the front desk. So every night when we got back to the hotel in the 30° weather of September, we had to go to the reception and ask them to turn on the A/C. The breakfast was pretty basic, but good. Espresso, coffee, tea, milk, juice, ham, cheese, bread, croissant, fruits, yogurt, jam, honey, cereal. The biggest problem with our stay was that upon checking out we were asked to pay for our stay. Which would have been fine, except that it was our impression that we had paid online by credit card when we had reserved our room. It was explained to us that the credit card number we provided was merely for safety reasons or something like that. So on the morning of our checkout, when we were supposed to be catching a train to the airport, we had to scramble to find a way to pay the hotel. We tried three different credit cards, which after 15 minute of waiting for their payment machine, were all rejected. And then we had to run out and look for an ATM to get some cash. We did miss the train to the airport, but luckily still made the flight. Not the best way to end a vacation in Roma. So beware when you pay.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazinmatt
Reviews.Content: We really struggled to find an affordable home in the centre of Rome, and were really happy to find Hotel Ercoli, which was running a half price offer throughout the summer, meaning our room worked out at 75 euros a night. We thought this was a pretty good deal, and compared to other hotels, I suppose it was - but having stayed at the hotel, I'd have been very annoyed if we'd paid any more than this. We arrived in the evening, and the person on duty at reception was an old man who was helpful enough in showing us the room, but couldn't conceal his annoyance that we couldn't converse with him in Italian. I understand his frustration, but expressing it to paying guests wasn't really the thing to do... it just made for an awkward atmosphere, and we didn't feel very welcome at all. The room was clean and comfortable, but very dark, and the air conditioner sometimes didn't seem to work. Breakfast was ok, but there was hardly any choice of food, and we both got rather fed up of bread rolls and iced croissants after 4 days. The hotel's saving grace was it's good location, which meant it was very easy to get to all the sights. All in all, a very average hotel - nothing really wrong with it, but pretty poor value. The only reason I would recommend it is the fact that it was well-priced for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, friendly hotel in a super location! We lucked out!”
Reviews.Author: xarina77
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by accident and we are so happy we stayed there. The hotel was clean, newly redecorated, with own bath/shower in rooms (I don't know if that's common or not in Italy). People were really nice. They had FREE internet during the day (after breakfast and before 7 p.m. or so - could have used it a little later, but that's okay!) on their own laptop that was sitting in a corner of the breakfast room - so no worries if you didn't have your own. The location was fantastic - a nice, safe, 20-minute or so walk west through quiet residential neighbourhoods to the Spanish Steps, but yet a close 10-min walk to the train station (Termini). And don't miss the great gelato place on the corner just two blocks south! I would totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Barely okay”
Reviews.Author: maggiekkk
Reviews.Content: Location wasn't bad, but not great; rooms were clean; breakfast was lousy, and the coffee undrinkable; some of the family was very polite, but the male night clerk was as rude as they get; there's a 10-10 limit on using the internet which is just stupid when you want to find things out in the early morning; I always had the feeling that I was being ripped off;

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families on a budget”
Reviews.Author: barbeauf
Reviews.Content: Great service from the staff. Everyone was courteous and helpful. It was 38 degrees C in Rome and our room air conditioning was defective. The staff found us another room for 4 the next morning with excellent air conditioning. Breakfast is basic but good. Hotel is clean, quiet. Perfectly situated in a nice and safe area. We were able to walk to all major sites without using public transportation, except for the Vatican. We would go back in a heartbeat. Only issue was with plumbing in the bathrooms, but nothing dramatic.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem of a dump!”
Reviews.Author: mrblue96
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about this hotel...thought I found an inexpensive gem...wow, how was I wrong. First and foremost, the air conditioner barely even worked while we were there...and we went in July. We mentioned it to the owners/staff and they stated that a worker was coming out the next day to fix the ac...but we had a portable fan and so we grinned and bared it. The next day, after coming back from touring, we found that we lost our portable fan and no technician had come and fixed our ac. We were basically told we had to suffer. The rooms were also very cramped with little room to maneuver. My girlfriend and I had stayed 2 nights at another hotel, Hotel Angel, which was awesome and so we were used to the rooms in Rome...but Hotel Ercoli was ridiculous. The bathroom was sketchy as well. No water pressure. A ceiling that was nothing more than a grate and a dark, recessed upper ceiling that could have housed who knows what was what we got to look up into! The water glass in the room was dirty and there was note on the wall asking us not to flush any toilet paper in the toilet and to throw any soiled toilet paper in the trash. Most shocking and a fact I didn't mention to my girlfriend was that when I used the community computer, I found bookmarks for pornographic sites...who knows who put them there...but nevertheless, they were there. And finally, in the morning when we checked out, I asked one the staff members if he could mail my postcards with his mail. Needless to say, none of my family members received their mail. All in all, a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DivingC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Ercoli on my first (and only trip until now) to Italy back in April 2007. This is a great budget hotel. The price was very decent. The hotel is a 15 minutes walk from the Termini (main train station) in a very nice (upscale) neighborhood and completely safe (compared to the hotels right beside the Termini). The room was normal size (for a hotel room in Europe - they are generally smaller than in North America), clean and comfortable. The service from the staff was good, they were very helpful. The breakfast was the American style, there was plenty of food: eggs, cereals and milk, croissants, brioches, cheese and cold cuts, toast, etc. It is a very good option if you are on a budget and would like to stay in a safe area that is not too touristy but close to everything if you don't mind 15-20 min walks. And do not forget to try the pizzeria that is on the same street!! We ate there twice in 4 days, it was so, soo good!

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel, but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: bretami
Reviews.Content: The Ercoli Hotel cannot be faulted for its cleanliness -- the room was very well kept and the bathroom was modern and updated. It was also a decent 10-15 minute walk to the train station. These two things made it a decent value for the 115 Euro we paid. The biggest problem we faced was its out of the way location from the main sites -- starting off the day it wasn't bad to walk to our destinations, but after a late dinner we were usually the only ones walking home. Very deserted in this part of town and hardly any restaurants or cafes open. Not necessarily unsafe, but just a little too quite. I would have much prefered to spend more monrey and stay nearer to the central part of Rome. We also did face some issues because the staff couldn't communicate in English and we couldn't speak Italian well. If you had a question or would want a recommendation, the staff was definitely not a resource. If you absolutely can't find something in a more travelled location, the Ercoli Hotel will do. Just remember that it is on the 3rd floor of a non-descript building -- just a small blue sign next to the door buzzer.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Proudly_SA27
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, this place is a little gem!! Situated quite close to the major train situation and also quite central in the city, its perfect for anyone wanting to experience all that rome has to offer! The rooms were spotless and comfortable, the only thing is the shower was a little cramped, but not a major problem. The buffet continental breakfast was great, with fresh croissants, rolls, juice, yoghurt and coffee - all ideal to get the day started! I will definitely stay here again if i go to rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ercoli is a good budget hotel not far from the major train station in Rome which is also a bus stop hub so transportation is pretty good. The hotel was clean but not very clean. The room is large enough however the shower is incredibily tiny and the temperature does not regulate well. It is not in a major tourist neighborhood of Rome but the area is well developed. The breakfast is great. The staff does not speak English but that does not really cause a problem if you do not speak Italian. If you book the hotel over the internet make sure to bring a print of the price that was agreed to with you as with most Roman hotels the price may vary. As Rome is a very expensive city if you want a decent hotel for a decent price this is a very good choice. Not perfect but very reasonable. Also the hotel is only on one of the floors in the building. You have to go up the stairs or the elevator to reach the hotel's front desk. When you walk in and see the empty building lobby on the bottom do not flip out like we almost did.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately uncomfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: vanillabeanspeck
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in excellent condition and the bedroom was reasonably roomy. The hotel was on the 3rd floor (accessible by stairs or elevator) of a building located conveniently next to a street full of shops and restaurants and a little off the main drag. The shower was very tiny to the point where I ended up hitting my elbows and knees against all four walls in order to soap up (and I am smaller than the average person). The other problem with the shower was that the water temperature wildly varied no matter where you set the dial, from cold to boiling hot. One of the staff was polite and welcoming although some of the other staff appeared rude. None of the staff understood English which made it hard for me to communicate my needs and questions. Although the room itself was designated nonsmoking, staff would smoke indoors; the smoke filled my room at night causing me to wheeze and my fellow guest to sneeze; we ended up putting towels against the door to try to avoid the constant secondhand smoke. The walls were thin and we could literally hear every word spoken by the other guests as they walked in the hallway. Breakfast consisted of delicious, fresh pastries, orange juice, various spreads, and good quality coffee. On the day of checkout, I was notified that the hotel was not taking credit cards, thus necessitating an extra trip to the bank to obtain enough cash to cover my stay. Overall, I was moderately uncomfortable with several aspects of this hotel and would not stay here again, given the variety of choices of lodging in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: dovedale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a group of friends and found it excellent for the price, Rooms spotless, good size, towels changed every day. As on previous reviews the shower has to been seen to be believed but you just get on with it. The staff were extremely helpful in giving directions, bus numbers and booking a restaurant for us one evening - - all without either of us speaking each others language. If you want no frills hotel book Ercoli Hotel for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fine little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kekocowan
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel in August 2005. Although a little out of the way, this hotel is in walking distance to a metro station and just fine for touring all the sights of Rome. The room was thoroughly adequate, plenty of room, fine bed, spotlessly clean, good storage space, and airconditioning. The bathroom was fine, shower is small. If you are much larger than 5'10" and 180 pounds, you will have a difficult time. Otherwise, you will be fine. Staff was most friendly and helpful, and breakfast is included. It is nothing fancy (strong coffee!), but plenty to hold you until lunchtime, and very convenient to be able to eat before you begin your day. A great value for the money. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is affordable and relatively clean but there are some things to be wary of. The towels were not changed daily, almost none of the staff spoke English and were not approachable, the showers were tiny and the water temperature unstable. Overall it was OK but we would rate it the lowest out of the 6 different hotels we stayed in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviews, we stayed here 5 nights in February 2005. Great value for the location. Spotlessly clean and friendly staff - and yes, the shower's are teeny-tiny. Our toilet ran incessantly, the manager tried to fix it but couldn't but when we closed the bathroom door we couldn't hear it. Looking at a map it seemed far out but after the first day of exploring we figured out a quicker way to get back to the hotel. We did almost everything on foot (the metro system is really easy, individual tickets valid for 90 min are 1 E or you can get a four day pass for 11 E - we bought the pass and ended up using the metro only 8 times in 4 days so it would have been cheaper to buy individual tickets - live and learn) and if you're walking straight through you can get to the Forums and Palatine Hill in 20-30 minutes (although it took us 6 hours cause there are a zillion other things to stop and gawk at along the way :). Definitely bring along an Italian/English dictionary if you need to speak to any of the staff - the day manager speaks some English but the night lady speaks no English whatsoever, it was realy hard to get a wake-up call with my limited Italian. Also - to avoid our first night debacle - be very careful to pinpoint the hotel on a map before you leave to go walking, the hotel is on the 3rd floor of a normal residential building and there's just a little sign next to the front door that's really easy to miss!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mr_terryCanada
Reviews.Content: Only seventy euros a night. The rooms were big and clean. It's about a ten minute walk to Termini. The breakfast was OK, fresh rolls and coffee and juice. The staff was friendly but didn't speak much English. Excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wgrc1971
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews, this hotel was outstanding for a resonable price (80 Euro / day for a double with shower). The staff was very friendly, even helping us in our goal to rearrange our travel plans later in the trip, and letting us access their internet connection. Rooms were spotlessly clean. Yeah, the shower was quite small as some others pointed out, but this is the only (minor) problem, and elsewere in Italy, we came across other small showers like that. Be warned: They couldn't accept credit cards when we were there, so take cash. Great restaurant nearby was Bella Napoli on via Alessandria, inexpensive but perhaps the best pizza I've ever had. Neighborhood is also nice, quiet area, and not a var walk from Borghese, or Termini. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “2 star gem”
Reviews.Author: nhl
Reviews.Content: I use tripadvisor alot to find reasonable accommodation and its come up trumps every time. This is my contribution. The hotel has been refurbished wonderfully although they could do with loosing the bidet and fitting a larger shower (don't even try to bend down!) hot water intermittent depending on if next room is using it too! Lovely breakfast , quiet street. Expect to pay 105 euros for a double with ensuite. Very friendly staff, reasonable position from sites (15 mins walk) Don't forget Vatican is closed Sundays , although you might get lucky and see the pope on the steps instead (as we did a few weeks ago)

Reviews.Title: “Great value in ROme”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but very comfortable and the staff very friendly. Our only criticism would be the showers - they are very small and the controls don't appear to work too well. However , for us it was more than adequate - plenty of clean towels every day. Value for money you couldn't get much better. Location wise extremely central, most places can be walked to if you don't mind a 15/20 minute walk. We can also recommend La Cantinola on Via Calabria (just around the corner) very good food at reasonable prices, also Taverna La Baita just up on Via Lucania, both represented good food at excellent value. Don't attempt the Piccolo Abruzzo can't remember the street but also close by - downstairs, looks good wonderful array of fresh food on display but you don't get to eat it. If you do go make sure you ask how much before you eat - it is a 'suggestion menu' and you get what they think you should have - we were totally ripped off there we were charged 45 euro per head whilst the previous two we paid 20 euro a head for equally good food.
